title: Ticket #7459: Rootly docker universe jobs need /tmp mounted 01777
description:
When HTCondor is built to allow docker universe jobs to run as root, it bind mounts /tmp into the scratch directory, just as usual. However, this directory it created 0755, owned by the non-root user the job would have run as. This isn't a problem for jobs that stay as root, but if they su to a non-root user, then they can't write to tmp.

Note that we can't make the bind-mounted /tmp 01777 for non-docker jobs, as that would allow random people to write into our /tmp, which is the problem that bind mounted is intended to fix. So, we'll make /tmp 01777 for all docker jobs.
